step1.para: Install the splitter sliding clutch on the output shaft, internal splines toward gear and engaged with the splines of the shaft (inset, Figure 309). Place the splitter shift yoke into position with the sliding clutch on the output shaft, yoke hub to the front of the housing.

figure.caption: Figure 308. Install Splitter Sliding Clutch and Place Splitter Shift Yoke into Position

step1.para: If previously removed, install the small O-ring in the bore of the cylinder housing (inset, Figure 310). Position the new gasket on the housing mounting surface and install the splitter cylinder housing in the rear bore of the auxiliary housing, air channel to the right.

figure.caption: Figure 309. Install Small O-Ring and Install Splitter Cylinder Housing

step1.para: If previously removed, install the O-ring in the O.D. groove of the yoke bar piston ( Figure 311).

figure.caption: Figure 310. Install O-Ring in O.D. Groove of Yoke Bar Piston

step1.para: From the rear of the housing, insert the yoke bar through the cylinder bore and into shift yoke, aligning the notch in the bar with the lockscrew hole in yoke hub ( Figure 312).

figure.caption: Figure 311. Insert Yoke Bar Through Cylinder Bore

step1.para: Install the yoke lockscrew, tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 Nm) and lockwire securely ( Figure 313).

If previously removed, install the insert valve in the bottom bore of the cylinder cover, flat end to the inside ( left, Figure 314). Install the valve retaining nut in the exhaust port of the cover and tighten to 40 to 50 ft-lbs. (54 to 68 Nm) ( right, Figure 314).

figure.caption: Figure 313. Install Insert Valve and Valve Retaining Nut

note.para: Prior to installation of the insert valve, make sure the three O-rings on the valve O.D. are not defective. Replace, if necessary.

step1.para: Position the new gasket on the cover mounting surface and install the splitter cylinder cover on the cylinder housing, exhaust port down ( Figure 315). Apply Loctite 242 to the bolt threads and tighten to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 Nm) to secure the cover to the cylinder housing.

note.para: With the cover installed in this manner, the air channel of the cover will align with that of the cylinder housing.
